greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of partitions of n where each part i is marked with a word of length i over a k-ary alphabet whose letters appear in alphabetical order and all k letters occur at least once in the partition; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
comment: T(n,k) is defined for n,k >= 0.  The triangle contains only the terms with k<=n. T(n,k) = 0 for k>n.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, i, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, `if`(i<1, 0,
b(n, i-1, k)+`if`(i>n, 0, b(n-i, i, k)*binomial(i+k-1, k-1))))
T:= (n, k)-> add(b(n$2, k-i)*(-1)^i*binomial(k, i), i=0..k):
mathematica: b[n_, i_, k_] := b[n, i, k] = If[n == 0, 1, If[i < 1, 0, b[n, i - 1, k] + If[i > n, 0, b[n - i, i, k]*Binomial[i + k - 1, k - 1]]]]; T[n_, k_] := Sum[b[n, n, k - i]*(-1)^i*Binomial[k, i], {i, 0, k}]; Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 21 2017, translated from Maple *)
xref: Cf. A060642, A261718, A261781 (same for compositions).
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Aug 29 2015
